ygData.subject: Re: Level 30,35,40,45, and a "power level" comme
ygData.msgSnippet: Wow, am I relieved not to be the oldest one (40) playing this. Whew! All in all - given the nature of the bard class - I think it probably appeals more to an
ygData.messageBody:
Wow, am I relieved not to be the oldest one (40) playing this. Whew!

All in all - given the nature of the bard class - I think it probably
appeals more to an older, more mature player.

We have moved past having to 'prove' ourselves - and have learned the value
of support - even if it's unrecognized support.

I don't WANT to be the hero - I really, really enjoy helping others do that.

To me, the bard class is just about as good as it gets for being a great
support character.




At 03:15 PM 7/15/99 -0400, you wrote:
>From: Bob Stewart <dreambard@...>
>
>At 10:49 AM 7/15/99 -0700, RON_TALBOT@... wrote:
>> What! gasp! You mean I'm not the only 30+ year old in the game...
>> Yea! There is hope for me after all...
>
>Hah! I laugh on your young lapel.
>
>I'm 51, married, and have 2 married sons who between them have 3 kids of
>their own. Both of them play EverQuest, too. Can anyone beat that?
>
>Neither of them wants to play a bard, but it other than old inertia to play
>a dwarf warrior, it was my obvious, enthusiastic choice.
>
> Bob
>
